member.name: T:InfoReg_SI.Format
member.summary: Format is a class that contains functions to adjust or parse numbers to and from strings like 10pF or 123.46 kilo-metres oe 65.123 ml.

member.name: M:InfoReg_SI.Format.SI_Format(System.Double,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Returns values in text in SI format. An example is 123.45km. It takes a double value and looks at its decimal exponent. The exponent is reduced to its residue three value. It then prefixes the unit passed in with the appropriate SI prefix.
"yotta-", "zetta-", "exa-", "peta-", "tera-", "giga-", "mega-", "kilo", "", "milli-", "micro-", "nano-", "pico-", "femto-", "atto-", "zepto-", "yocto-"
If siunit is two or less characters the return will use short SI prefixes like: "Y", "Z", "E", "P", "T", "G", "M", "k", "", "m", "μ", "n", "p", "f", "a", "z", "y"
No prefix is needed for the d_val lies in the range 0.0 to just under 1000.0.
Note: hecto, deca, deci, and centi are not supported. SI does not support numbers above 10^27 or below 10^-24 and any such value will be returned unmodified without SI prefix units.
member.param: A double value to be SI normalized.
Is the format string usually based on G or N
An SI unit like watt, metre or l

member.name: M:InfoReg_SI.Format.SI_Format(System.Single,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
This converts the float to a double and uses the SI_Format(Double d_val, String sformat, String siunit) function. Returns values in a text SI format. An example is 123.45km. It takes a float value and looks at its decimal exponent. The exponent is reduced to its residue three value. It then prefixes the unit passed in with the appropriate SI prefix.
"yotta-", "zetta-", "exa-", "peta-", "tera-", "giga-", "mega-", "kilo", "", "milli-", "micro-", "nano-", "pico-", "femto-", "atto-", "zepto-", "yocto-"
If siunit is two or less characters the return will use short SI prefixes like: "Y", "Z", "E", "P", "T", "G", "M", "k", "", "m", "μ", "n", "p", "f", "a", "z", "y"
No prefix is needed for the d_val lies in the range 0.0 to just under 1000.0.
Note: hecto, deca, deci, and centi are not supported. SI does not support numbers above 10^27 or below 10^-24 and any such value will be returned unmodified without SI prefix units.
member.param: A float value to be SI normalized.
Is the format string usually based on G or N
An SI unit like watt, metre or l

member.name: M:InfoReg_SI.Format.SI_Format(System.Decimal,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Returns values in text in SI format. An example is 123.45km. It takes a decimal value and looks at its decimal exponent. The exponent is reduced to its residue three value. It then prefixes the unit passed in with the appropriate SI prefix.
"yotta-", "zetta-", "exa-", "peta-", "tera-", "giga-", "mega-", "kilo", "", "milli-", "micro-", "nano-", "pico-", "femto-", "atto-", "zepto-", "yocto-"
If siunit is two or less characters the return will use short SI prefixes like: "Y", "Z", "E", "P", "T", "G", "M", "k", "", "m", "μ", "n", "p", "f", "a", "z", "y"
No prefix is needed for the d_val lies in the range 0.0 to just under 1000.0.
Note: hecto, deca, deci, and centi are not supported. SI does not support numbers above 10^27 or below 10^-24 and any such value will be returned unmodified without SI prefix units.
member.param: A decimal value to be SI normalized.
Is the format string usually based on G or N
An SI unit like watt, metre or l

member.name: M:InfoReg_SI.Format.SI_Parse(System.String,System.Double@)
member.summary: Takes an SI formatted value like "12.34 km" and returns a double with the value 1.234e4. A String "10pF" would be returned as a double value 1e-11.
member.param: A double that will be assigned the parsed value from the SI formatted string
member.returns: A double value adjusted for the SI prefix value.

member.name: M:InfoReg_SI.Format.SI_Parse(System.String,System.Decimal@)
member.summary: Takes an SI formatted value like "12.34 km" and returns a decimal with the value 1.234e4. A String "10pF" would be returned as a decimal value 1e-11.
member.param: A decimal that will be assigned the parsed value from the SI formatted string
member.returns: A decimal value adjusted for the SI prefix value.

member.name: M:InfoReg_SI.Format.SI_Parse(System.String,System.Single@)
member.summary:
Takes an SI formatted value like "12.34 km" and returns a float with the value 1.234e4. A String "10pF" would be returned as a float value 1e-11.
This function call SI_ParseDouble and converts the double to a float.
member.param: A float that will be assigned the parsed value from the SI formatted string
member.returns: A float value adjusted for the SI prefix value.
